    • Method Detail

      • addDay

        public boolean addDay(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
             int timeStamp,
             int dayStamp,
             int dayNumber,
             float currTemp,
             float currPress,
             float currHumid,
             float currMaxTemp,
             float currMinTemp,
             float currAvgTemp,
             float currMaxPress,
             float currMinPress,
             float currAvgPress,
             float currMaxHumid,
             float currMinHumid,
             float currAvgHumid)
        Add an entry to the database
        Parameters:
        db - pointer to database
        timeStamp - hour of measurment
        dayStamp - day of measurment
        dayNumber - recorded day (1-31)
        currTemp - measured temperature
        currPress - measured pressure
        currHumid - measured humidity
        currMaxTemp - max temperature of a day
        currMinTemp - min temperature of a day
        currAvgTemp - average temperature of a day
        currMaxPress - max pressure of a day
        currMinPress - min pressure of a day
        currAvgPress - average pressure of a day
        currMaxHumid - max humidity of a day
        currMinHumid - min humidity of a day
        currAvgHumid - average humidity of a day
        Returns:
        boolean true if addDay was successful false if addDay failed

      • backupDBasJSON

        public static boolean backupDBasJSON()
        Backup database in JSON format on SD card File is saved in /WeatherStation/MM-dd-WeatherStation.JSON MM = month dd = today's day
        Returns:
        boolean true => write to file successful false => write to file failed

      • cleanDB

        public void cleanDB(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Delete all entries in the data base
        Parameters:
        db - pointer to database

      • deleteDay

        private void deleteDay(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Deletes all entries matching with dayNumber
        Parameters:
        db - pointer to database

      • exportDatabase

        public static boolean exportDatabase()
        Read all entries from the database and write them in CSV format to the external storage File is saved in /WeatherStation/MM-dd-WeatherStation.csv MM = month dd = today's day
        Returns:
        boolean true if file could be created false if there was an error

      • getAll

        private android.database.Cursor getAll(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Read all rows and return the data as a cursor
        Parameters:
        db - pointer to database
        Returns:
        Cursor dayStamp Cursor with all database entries matching with dayNumber

      • getDay

        public android.database.Cursor getDay(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                             int dayNumber)
        Read data of day "dayNumber" and returns the data as a cursor
        Parameters:
        db - pointer to database
        dayNumber - the day we want to read (1-31)
        Returns:
        Cursor dayStamp Cursor with all database entries matching with dayNumber

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase database)
        Description copied from class: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Called when the database is created for the first time. This is where the creation of tables and the initial population of the tables should happen.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        database - The database.

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
             int oldVersion,
             int newVersion)
        Description copied from class: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Called when the database needs to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to drop tables, add tables, or do anything else it needs to upgrade to the new schema version.

        The SQLite ALTER TABLE documentation can be found here. If you add new columns you can use ALTER TABLE to insert them into a live table. If you rename or remove columns you can use ALTER TABLE to rename the old table, then create the new table and then populate the new table with the contents of the old table.

        This method executes within a transaction. If an exception is thrown, all changes will automatically be rolled back.

        Specified by:
        onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - The database.
        oldVersion - The old database version.
        newVersion - The new database version.

      • restoreDBfromJSON

        public static boolean restoreDBfromJSON()
        Restore database from JSON format file
        Returns:
        boolean true => restore to database successful false => restore to database failed

      • shiftDays

        public void shiftDays(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Makes space for the next day entries and deletes the oldest entry This way only records of the last 31 days are stored
        Parameters:
        db - pointer to database
